content.question:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

The images show a complete view and a detailed view of the same work.

Attribute the work shown to a specific culture from West and Central Asia (500 B.C.E.—1980 C.E.).

Using at least two examples of specific visual evidence, justify your attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type and from the same culture.

Using specific evidence, explain how at least one visual characteristic of the work was achieved through the use of a specific artistic technique.

Using specific evidence, explain how the visual characteristics of the work reflects the cultural context in which works of this type were created.
